Properties.AssetModelDescription: Areas are physical, geographic, or logical groupings determined by the site. It may include process units, production units, and production lines. Most 3-level functions occur in this area. The main production capacity and geographic location within a location usually determine the area.

An Enterprise is a collection of one or more venues, which may include venues and areas. The company is responsible for determining which products will be produced, where they will be manufactured, and how they will generally be manufactured. Level 4 functions are handled at the enterprise and site level. However, business plans may involve areas, units, lines, or units within an area.

A site is a physical, geographic, or logical grouping determined by the company. It may include areas, production lines, process units and production units. The four-level function of the a site involves local location management and optimization. Site planning may involve units, production lines, or units in the area. Geographic location and main production capacity usually identify a location. The location usually has well-defined manufacturing capabilities.
